review_title: Very friendly staff personally I found that it needed more staff
pros: My trainer was a lovely lady and very experienced person
cons: Need more staff and better wages

job_title: Care Coordinator in Perth, Western Australia
pros: Baptistcare provided a lot of learning opportunities.
cons: Hierarchical leadership with limited back-up at times.

review_title: Made me want to quit nursing
job_title: Endorsed Enrolled Nurse in Perth, Western Australia
pros: I had money in my bank account
cons: Too much work for one nurse. Severely understaffed. Patient ratios mean nothing. Work environment was awful with staff having cliques and being hostile towards anyone who dares ask them for help. Belongings stolen by staff and nothing done about it. Staying back after work due to incidents and having a duty of care, no overtime pay no matter how many times I asked (4 hour shifts with no break turned into 6 hours sometimes). Asking me, a graduate enrolled nurse to work a double shift (afternoon into night shift) as a registered nurse because they didn't want to pay for an agency nurse, no thanks: I'm not qualified and I was still getting used to my job.

Low side pay
Under staffed
Poor facility management
Head office doesn't care

pros: Excellent care staff, who genuinely look after the residents.

review_title: Terrible. No desire to engage with their workforce and involve them in decisions. Very poor communication throughout
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Perth, Western Australia
pros: Interesting and growing sector. Good salary packaging options. Some great and caring people amongst the workforce. CEO is friendly and approachable.
cons: Poor culture. Senior managers do not have the required skills or desire to promote positive change. Make knee jerk decisions that negatively impact people. Can not settle on a how to structure the business so make regular redundancies. Does not always have the best interest of the employee at heart.
